017package org.microbean.type;
018
019import java.lang.reflect.Array;
020import java.lang.reflect.GenericArrayType;
021import java.lang.reflect.ParameterizedType;
022import java.lang.reflect.Type;
023import java.lang.reflect.TypeVariable;
024import java.lang.reflect.WildcardType;
025
026import java.util.Collection;
027import java.util.Collections;
028import java.util.Comparator;
029import java.util.HashMap;
030import java.util.HashSet;
031import java.util.LinkedHashSet;
032import java.util.Map;
033import java.util.Objects;
034import java.util.Set;
035
036import java.util.function.Function;
037import java.util.function.Predicate;
038
039/**
040 * A hub for Java {@link Type}-related operations.
041 *
042 * @author <a href="https://about.me/lairdnelson"
043 * target="_parent">Laird Nelson</a>
044 *
045 * @see #toTypes(Type)
046 *
047 * @threadsafety Instances of this class are safe for concurrent use
048 * by multiple threads.
049 */
050public final class Types {
051
052
053  /*
054   * Static fields.
055   */
056
057
058  static final Comparator<Type> typeNameComparator = new TypeNameComparator();
059
060  private static final Map<Class<?>, Type> wrapperTypes;
061
062  static {
063    final Map<Class<?>, Type> map = new HashMap<>();
064    map.put(boolean.class, Boolean.class);
065    map.put(byte.class, Byte.class);
066    map.put(char.class, Character.class);
067    map.put(double.class, Double.class);
068    map.put(float.class, Float.class);
069    map.put(int.class, Integer.class);
070    map.put(long.class, Long.class);
071    map.put(short.class, Short.class);
072    map.put(void.class, Void.class);
073    wrapperTypes = Collections.unmodifiableMap(map);
074  }
075
076
077  /*
078   * Constructors.
079   */
080
081
082  /**
083   * Creates a new {@link Types}.
084   */
085  private Types() {
086    super();
087  }
088
089
090  /*
091   * Methods.
092   */
093
094
095  /**
096   * For the vast majority of cases, returns the supplied {@link Type}
097   * unchanged, but in the case where a raw {@link Class} is supplied,
098   * returns an equivalent {@link ParameterizedType} whose {@linkplain
099   * ParameterizedType#getActualTypeArguments() actual type arguments}
100   * are not resolved.
101   *
102   * @param type the {@link Type} to normalize; may be {@code null} in
103   * which case {@code null} will be returned; will often be returned
104   * unchanged
105   *
106   * @return the normalized {@link Type}; {@code null} if {@code type}
107   * was {@code null}
108   *
109   * @nullability This method may return {@code null} only if the
110   * supplied {@link Type} is {@code null}.
111   *
112   * @threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple
113   * threads.
114   */
115  public static final Type normalize(final Type type) {
116    final Type returnValue;
117    if (type instanceof Class<?> cls) {
118      final Type[] typeParameters = cls.getTypeParameters();
119      if (typeParameters == null || typeParameters.length <= 0) {
120        final Type componentType = cls.getComponentType();
121        if (componentType == null) {
122          returnValue = type;
123        } else {
124          final Type normalizedComponentType = normalize(componentType); // XXX recursive
125          if (componentType == normalizedComponentType) {
126            returnValue = type;
127          } else {
128            returnValue = new DefaultGenericArrayType(normalizedComponentType);
129          }
130        }
131      } else {
132        returnValue = new DefaultParameterizedType(cls.getDeclaringClass(), cls, typeParameters);
133      }
134    } else {
135      returnValue = type;
136    }
137    return returnValue;
138  }
139
140  /*
141   * Bookmark: resolve(Type)
142   */
143
144  /**
145   * Resolves the supplied {@link Type} and returns the result.
146   *
147   * @param type the {@link Type} to resolve; may be {@code null}
148   *
149   * @param typeResolver the {@link Function} whose {@link
150   * Function#apply(Object)} method will be called on, among other
151   * things, {@link ParameterizedType} {@linkplain
152   * ParameterizedType#getActualTypeArguments() type arguments}; must
153   * not be {@code null}
154   *
155   * @return the resolved {@link Type}, or {@code null}
156   *
157   * @nullability This method may return {@code null}.
158   *
159   * @threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple
160   * threads.
161   *
162   * @idempotency This method is idempotent and deterministic.
163   *
164   * @see #resolve(Type, Function, boolean)
165   */
166  public static final Type resolve(Type type, final Function<? super Type, ? extends Type> typeResolver) {
167    return resolve(type, typeResolver, false);
168  }
169
170  /**
171   * Resolves the supplied {@link Type} and returns the result.
172   *
173   * @param type the {@link Type} to resolve; may be {@code null}
174   *
175   * @param typeResolver the {@link Function} whose {@link
176   * Function#apply(Object)} method will be called on, among other
177   * things, {@link ParameterizedType} {@linkplain
178   * ParameterizedType#getActualTypeArguments() type arguments}; must
179   * not be {@code null}
180   *
181   * @param normalize whether the {@link #normalize(Type)} method
182   * should be called on the supplied {@link Type}
183   *
184   * @return the resolved {@link Type}, or {@code null}
185   *
186   * @nullability This method may return {@code null}.
187   *
188   * @threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple
189   * threads.
190   *
191   * @idempotency This method is idempotent and deterministic.
192   *
193   * @since 0.0.3
194   */
195  public static final Type resolve(Type type, final Function<? super Type, ? extends Type> typeResolver, final boolean normalize) {
196    final Type returnValue;
197    if (normalize) {
198      type = normalize(type);
199    }
200    if (type instanceof Class<?> cls) {
201      returnValue = resolve(cls, typeResolver, normalize);
202    } else if (type instanceof ParameterizedType parameterizedType) {
203      returnValue = resolve(parameterizedType, typeResolver, normalize);
204    } else if (type instanceof GenericArrayType genericArrayType) {
205      returnValue = resolve(genericArrayType, typeResolver, normalize);
206    } else if (type instanceof TypeVariable<?> typeVariable) {
207      returnValue = resolve(typeVariable, typeResolver, normalize);
208    } else if (type instanceof WildcardType wildcardType) {
209      // (No-op.)
210      returnValue = resolve(wildcardType, typeResolver, normalize);
211    } else {
212      // (Unknown type, so we don't know how to resolve it.)
213      returnValue = type;
214    }
215    return returnValue;
216  }
217
218  private static final Type resolve(final Class<?> type, final Function<? super Type, ? extends Type> typeResolver, final boolean normalizeIgnored) {
219    final Type candidate = typeResolver.apply(type);
220    return candidate == null ? type : candidate;
221  }
222
223  private static final Type resolve(final ParameterizedType type, final Function<? super Type, ? extends Type> typeResolver, final boolean normalize) {
224    final Type candidate = typeResolver.apply(type);
225    if (candidate == null) {
226      final Type[] actualTypeArguments = type.getActualTypeArguments();
227      final int length = actualTypeArguments.length;
228      final Type[] resolvedActualTypeArguments = new Type[length];
229      boolean createNewType = false;
230      for (int i = 0; i < length; i++) {
231        final Type actualTypeArgument = actualTypeArguments[i];
232        final Type resolvedActualTypeArgument = resolve(actualTypeArgument, typeResolver, normalize); // XXX recursive
233        resolvedActualTypeArguments[i] = resolvedActualTypeArgument;
234        if (actualTypeArgument != resolvedActualTypeArgument) {
235          // If they're not the same object reference, then resolution
236          // did something, so we have to return a new type, not the
237          // one we were handed.
238          createNewType = true;
239        }
240      }
241      return createNewType ? new DefaultParameterizedType(type.getOwnerType(), type.getRawType(), resolvedActualTypeArguments) : type;
242    } else {
243      return candidate;
244    }
245
246  }
247
248  private static final Type resolve(final GenericArrayType type, final Function<? super Type, ? extends Type> typeResolver, final boolean normalize) {
249    final Type returnValue;
250    final Type candidate = typeResolver.apply(type);
251    if (candidate == null) {
252      final Type genericComponentType = type.getGenericComponentType();
253      final Type resolvedComponentType = resolve(genericComponentType, typeResolver, normalize); // XXX recursive
254      assert resolvedComponentType != null;
255      if (resolvedComponentType == genericComponentType) {
256        // Identity means that basically resolution was a no-op, so the
257        // genericComponentType was whatever it was, and so we are going
258        // to be a no-op as well.
259        returnValue = type;
260      } else if (resolvedComponentType instanceof Class<?> componentType) {
261        // This might happen when genericComponentType was a
262        // TypeVariable.  In this case, it might get resolved to a
263        // simple scalar (e.g. Integer.class).  Now we have,
264        // effectively, a GenericArrayType whose genericComponentType is
265        // just a plain class.  That's actually just an ordinary Java
266        // array, so "resolve" this type by returning its array
267        // equivalent.
268        returnValue = Array.newInstance(componentType, 0).getClass();
269      } else {
270        // If we get here, we know that resolution actually did
271        // something, so return a new GenericArrayType implementation
272        // whose component type is the resolved version of the
273        // original's.
274        returnValue = new DefaultGenericArrayType(resolvedComponentType);
275      }
276    } else {
277      returnValue = candidate;
278    }
279    return returnValue;
280  }
281
282  private static final Type resolve(final TypeVariable<?> type, final Function<? super Type, ? extends Type> typeResolver, final boolean normalizeIgnored) {
283    final Type candidate = typeResolver.apply(type);
284    return candidate == null ? type : candidate;
285  }
286
287  private static final Type resolve(final WildcardType type, final Function<? super Type, ? extends Type> typeResolver, final boolean normalizeIgnored) {
288    final Type candidate = typeResolver.apply(type);
289    return candidate == null ? type : candidate;
290  }
291
292
293  /*
294   * Bookmark: toTypes(Type)
295   */
296
297
298  /**
299   * Returns a non-{@code null}, {@linkplain
300   * Collections#unmodifiableSet(Set) unmodifiable <code>Set</code>}
301   * of {@link Type}s, each element of which is a {@link Type} which
302   * any instance bearing the supplied {@link Type} will implement.
303   *
304   * <p>The {@link Set} that is returned is guaranteed to not contain
305   * {@link WildcardType} or {@link TypeVariable} instances.</p>
306   *
307   * @param type the {@link Type} whose type closure should be
308   * computed; may be {@code null}
309   *
310   * @return a non-{@code null} {@link TypeSet} <code>Set</code>} of
311   * {@link Type}s; the supplied {@link Type} will be one of its
312   * elements unless it is a {@link TypeVariable} or a {@link
313   * WildcardType}
314   *
315   * @nullability This method never returns {@code null}.
316   *
317   * @threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple
318   * threads.
319   *
320   * @idempotency This method is idempotent.
321   *
322   * @see #toTypes(Type, Predicate, boolean)
323   */
324  public static final TypeSet toTypes(final Type type) {
325    return toTypes(type, null, false);
326  }
327
328  /**
329   * Returns a non-{@code null}, {@linkplain
330   * Collections#unmodifiableSet(Set) unmodifiable <code>Set</code>}
331   * of {@link Type}s, each element of which is a {@link Type} which
332   * any instance bearing the supplied {@link Type} will implement.
333   *
334   * <p>The {@link Set} that is returned is guaranteed to not contain
335   * {@link WildcardType} or {@link TypeVariable} instances.</p>
336   *
337   * @param type the {@link Type} whose type closure should be
338   * computed; may be {@code null}
339   *
340   * @param normalize whether the {@link #normalize(Type)} method
341   * should be called on the supplied {@link Type} (provided it
342   * {@linkplain #isRawClass(Type) is not a raw <code>Class</code>})
343   *
344   * @return a non-{@code null} {@link TypeSet} <code>Set</code>} of
345   * {@link Type}s; the supplied {@link Type} will be one of its
346   * elements unless it is a {@link TypeVariable} or a {@link
347   * WildcardType}
348   *
349   * @nullability This method never returns {@code null}.
350   *
351   * @threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple
352   * threads.
353   *
354   * @idempotency This method is idempotent.
355   *
356   * @see #toTypes(Type, Predicate, boolean)
357   *
358   * @since 0.0.3
359   */
360  public static final TypeSet toTypes(final Type type, final boolean normalize) {
361    return toTypes(type, null, normalize);
362  }
363
364  /**
365   * Returns a non-{@code null}, {@linkplain
366   * Collections#unmodifiableSet(Set) unmodifiable <code>Set</code>}
367   * of {@link Type}s, each element of which is a {@link Type} which
368   * any instance bearing the supplied {@link Type} will implement.
369   *
370   * <p>The {@link Set} that is returned is guaranteed to not contain
371   * {@link WildcardType} or {@link TypeVariable} instances.</p>
372   *
373   * <p>If the supplied {@link Predicate} returns {@code true} from an
374   * invocation of its {@link Predicate#test(Object)} method, then the
375   * {@link Type} that was passed to it will not be contained by the
376   * returned {@link TypeSet}.</p>
377   *
378   * @param type the {@link Type} whose type closure should be
379   * computed; may be {@code null}
380   *
381   * @param removalPredicate a {@link Predicate} used to selectively
382   * remove some {@link Type}s from the computed {@link TypeSet}; may
383   * be {@code null}
384   *
385   * @return a non-{@code null} {@link TypeSet} <code>Set</code>} of
386   * {@link Type}s, filtered by the supplied {@link Predicate}
387   *
388   * @nullability This method never returns {@code null}.
389   *
390   * @threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple
391   * threads.
392   *
393   * @idempotency This method is idempotent.
394   *
395   * @see #toTypes(Type, Predicate, boolean)
396   */
397  public static final TypeSet toTypes(final Type type, Predicate<? super Type> removalPredicate) {
398    return toTypes(type, removalPredicate, false);
399  }
400
401  /**
402   * Returns a non-{@code null}, {@linkplain
403   * Collections#unmodifiableSet(Set) unmodifiable <code>Set</code>}
404   * of {@link Type}s, each element of which is a {@link Type} which
405   * any instance bearing the supplied {@link Type} will implement.
406   *
407   * <p>The {@link Set} that is returned is guaranteed to not contain
408   * {@link WildcardType} or {@link TypeVariable} instances.</p>
409   *
410   * <p>If the supplied {@link Predicate} returns {@code true} from an
411   * invocation of its {@link Predicate#test(Object)} method, then the
412   * {@link Type} that was passed to it will not be contained by the
413   * returned {@link TypeSet}.</p>
414   *
415   * @param type the {@link Type} whose type closure should be
416   * computed; may be {@code null}
417   *
418   * @param removalPredicate a {@link Predicate} used to selectively
419   * remove some {@link Type}s from the computed {@link TypeSet}; may
420   * be {@code null}
421   *
422   * @param normalize whether the {@link #normalize(Type)} method
423   * should be called on the supplied {@link Type} (provided it
424   * {@linkplain #isRawClass(Type) is not a raw <code>Class</code>})
425   *
426   * @return a non-{@code null} {@link TypeSet} <code>Set</code>} of
427   * {@link Type}s, filtered by the supplied {@link Predicate}
428   *
429   * @nullability This method never returns {@code null}.
430   *
431   * @threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple
432   * threads.
433   *
434   * @idempotency This method is idempotent.
435   *
436   * @since 0.0.3
437   */
438  public static final TypeSet toTypes(final Type type, Predicate<? super Type> removalPredicate, final boolean normalize) {
439    final Map<Type, Type> resolvedTypes = new HashMap<>();
440    toTypes(type, isRawClass(type), resolvedTypes, normalize);
441    resolvedTypes.keySet()
442      .removeIf(k -> !(k instanceof Class) || removalPredicate != null && removalPredicate.test(resolvedTypes.get(k)));
443    return resolvedTypes.isEmpty() ? TypeSet.EMPTY_TYPESET : new TypeSet(resolvedTypes.values());
444  }
445
446  private static final void toTypes(Type type,
447                                    final boolean noParameterizedTypes,
448                                    final Map<Type, Type> resolvedTypes,
449                                    final boolean normalize) {
450    if (normalize && !noParameterizedTypes) {
451      type = normalize(type);
452    }
453    if (type == null) {
454      // Do nothing on purpose
455    } else if (type instanceof Class<?> cls) {
456      toTypes(cls, noParameterizedTypes, resolvedTypes, normalize);
457    } else if (type instanceof ParameterizedType parameterizedType) {
458      toTypes(parameterizedType, noParameterizedTypes, resolvedTypes, normalize);
459    } else if (type instanceof GenericArrayType genericArrayType) {
460      toTypes(genericArrayType, noParameterizedTypes, resolvedTypes, normalize);
461    } else if (type instanceof TypeVariable<?> typeVariable) {
462      // Do nothing on purpose
463    } else if (type instanceof WildcardType wildcardType) {
464      // Do nothing on purpose
465    } else {
466      throw new IllegalArgumentException("Unexpected type: " + type);
467    }
468  }
469
470  private static final void toTypes(final Class<?> cls,
471                                    final boolean noParameterizedTypes,
472                                    final Map<Type, Type> resolvedTypes,
473                                    final boolean normalize) {
474    resolvedTypes.put(cls, resolve(cls, resolvedTypes::get, normalize));
475    final Type superclass = noParameterizedTypes ? cls.getSuperclass() : cls.getGenericSuperclass();
476    if (superclass != null) {
477      toTypes(superclass, noParameterizedTypes || isRawClass(superclass), resolvedTypes, normalize);
478    }
479    final Type[] interfaces = noParameterizedTypes ? cls.getInterfaces() : cls.getGenericInterfaces();
480    for (final Type iface : interfaces) {
481      toTypes(iface, noParameterizedTypes || isRawClass(iface), resolvedTypes, normalize);
482    }
483  }
484
485  private static final void toTypes(final ParameterizedType parameterizedType,
486                                    final boolean noParameterizedTypes,
487                                    final Map<Type, Type> resolvedTypes,
488                                    final boolean normalize) {
489    final Class<?> rawType = toClass(parameterizedType);
490    if (rawType != null) {
491      if (!noParameterizedTypes) {
492        final TypeVariable<?>[] typeVariables = rawType.getTypeParameters();
493        final Type[] typeVariableValues = parameterizedType.getActualTypeArguments();
494        assert typeVariables.length == typeVariableValues.length;
495        for (int i = 0; i < typeVariables.length; i++) {
496          resolvedTypes.put(typeVariables[i], resolve(typeVariableValues[i], resolvedTypes::get, normalize));
497        }
498      }
499      resolvedTypes.put(rawType, resolve(parameterizedType, resolvedTypes::get, normalize));
500      toTypes(rawType, noParameterizedTypes, resolvedTypes, normalize);
501    }
502  }
503
504  private static final void toTypes(final GenericArrayType genericArrayType,
505                                    final boolean noParameterizedTypes,
506                                    final Map<Type, Type> resolvedTypes,
507                                    final boolean normalize) {
508    final Class<?> rawType = toClass(genericArrayType);
509    if (rawType != null) {
510      final Class<?> arrayType = Array.newInstance(rawType, 0).getClass();
511      resolvedTypes.put(arrayType, genericArrayType);
512      toTypes(arrayType, noParameterizedTypes, resolvedTypes, normalize);
513    }
514  }
515
516  /**
517   * Returns the result of <a
518   * href="https://docs.oracle.com/javase/specs/jls/se13/html/jls-5.html#jls-5.1.7">boxing
519   * conversion</a> on the supplied {@link Type}.
520   *
521   * <p>In most cases this means the supplied {@link Type} is returned
522   * unchanged.</p>
523   *
524   * <p>This method calls {@link #isPrimitive(Type)} as part of its
525   * execution.</p>
526   *
527   * @param <T> the kind of {@link Type} in question
528   *
529   * @param type the {@link Type} to test
530   *
531   * @return the result of <a
532   * href="https://docs.oracle.com/javase/specs/jls/se13/html/jls-5.html#jls-5.1.7">boxing
533   * conversion</a> on the supplied {@link Type}
534   *
535   * @nullability This method will return {@code null} if {@code type}
536   * is {@code null}.
537   *
538   * @threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple
539   * threads.
540   *
541   * @idempotency This method is idempotent.
542   *
543   * @see #isPrimitive(Type)
544   */
545  @SuppressWarnings("unchecked")
546  public static final <T extends Type> T box(final T type) {
547    // We don't just blindly look up in wrapperTypes.  We call
548    // isPrimitive(Type) first (which will almost certainly be inlined
549    // by the JVM) to potentially avoid the Map lookup.
550    return isPrimitive(type) ? (T)wrapperTypes.getOrDefault(type, type) : type;
551  }
552
553  /**
554   * Returns {@code true} if and only if {@code type} is a {@link
555   * Class} and {@linkplain Class#isPrimitive() is primitive}.
556   *
557   * @param type the {@link Type} to test; may be {@code null} in
558   * which case {@code false} will be returned
559   *
560   * @return {@code true} if and only if {@code type} is a {@link
561   * Class} and {@linkplain Class#isPrimitive() is primitive}
562   *
563   * @threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple
564   * threads.
565   *
566   * @idempotency This method is idempotent.
567   */
568  public static final boolean isPrimitive(final Type type) {
569    return type instanceof Class<?> cls && cls.isPrimitive();
570  }
571
572  /**
573   * Returns {@code true} if and only if the supplied {@link Type} is
574   * a raw {@link Class}.
575   *
576   * <p>This method returns {@code true} if:</p>
577   *
578   * <ul>
579   *
580   * <li>The supplied {@link Type} is an instance of {@link Class},
581   * and any of the following conditions is true:
582   *
583   * <ul>
584   *
585   * <li>The return value of invoking this method on the {@linkplain
586   * Class class}' {@linkplain Class#getComponentType() component
587   * type} is {@code true}</li>
588   *
589   * <li>The {@linkplain Class class} {@linkplain
590   * Class#getTypeParameters() has type parameters}</li>
591   *
592   * </ul>
593   *
594   * </li>
595   *
596   * </ul>
597   *
598   * @param type the {@link Type} in question; may be {@code null} in
599   * which case {@code false} will be returned
600   *
601   * @return {@code true} if and only if the supplied {@link Type} is
602   * a raw {@link Class}
603   */
604  public static final boolean isRawClass(final Type type) {
605    return type instanceof Class<?> cls && (isRawClass(cls.getComponentType()) || cls.getTypeParameters().length > 0);
606  }
607
608  /**
609   * Does what is necessary to extract a {@link Class} from the
610   * supplied {@link Type} if at all possible.
611   *
612   * <ul>
613   *
614   * <li>If a {@link Class} is supplied, the {@link Class} is simply
615   * returned.</li>
616   *
617   * <li>If a {@link ParameterizedType} is supplied, the result of
618   * invoking {@link #toClass(Type)} on its {@linkplain
619   * ParameterizedType#getRawType() raw type} is returned.</li>
620   *
621   * <li>If a {@link GenericArrayType} is supplied, the result of
622   * invoking {@link #toClass(Type)} on its {@linkplain
623   * GenericArrayType#getGenericComponentType() generic component
624   * type} is returned.</li>
625   *
626   * <li>If a {@link TypeVariable} is supplied, the result of invoking
627   * {@link #toClass(Type)} on its {@linkplain
628   * TypeVariable#getBounds() first bound} is returned (if it has one)
629   * or {@link Object Object.class} if it does not.  <strong>Any other
630   * bounds are ignored.</strong></li>
631   *
632   * <li>If a {@link WildcardType} is supplied, the result of invoking
633   * {@link #toClass(Type)} on its {@linkplain
634   * WildcardType#getUpperBounds() first upper bound} is returned.
635   * <strong>Any other bounds are ignored.</strong></li>
636   *
637   * </ul>
638   *
639   * @param type the {@link Type} for which a {@link Class} is to be
640   * returned; may be {@code null} in which case {@code null} will be
641   * returned
642   *
643   * @return a {@link Class}, or {@code null} if a suitable raw type
644   * could not be determined
645   *
646   * @nullability This method may return {@code null}.
647   *
648   * @threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by mutltiple
649   * threads.
650   *
651   * @idempotency This method is idempotent and deterministic.
652   */
653  public static final Class<?> toClass(final Type type) {
654    final Class<?> returnValue;
655    if (type == null) {
656      returnValue = null;
657    } else if (type instanceof Class<?> cls) {
658      returnValue = toClass(cls);
659    } else if (type instanceof ParameterizedType parameterizedType) {
660      returnValue = toClass(parameterizedType);
661    } else if (type instanceof GenericArrayType genericArrayType) {
662      returnValue = toClass(genericArrayType);
663    } else if (type instanceof TypeVariable<?> typeVariable) {
664      returnValue = toClass(typeVariable);
665    } else if (type instanceof WildcardType wildcardType) {
666      returnValue = toClass(wildcardType);
667    } else {
668      returnValue = null;
669    }
670    return returnValue;
671  }
672
673  private static final Class<?> toClass(final Class<?> type) {
674    return type;
675  }
676
677  private static final Class<?> toClass(final ParameterizedType type) {
678    return type == null ? null : toClass(type.getRawType());
679  }
680
681  private static final Class<?> toClass(final GenericArrayType type) {
682    final Class<?> candidate = type == null ? null : toClass(type.getGenericComponentType());
683    return candidate == null ? null : (Class<?>)Array.newInstance(candidate, 0).getClass();
684  }
685
686  private static final Class<?> toClass(final TypeVariable<?> type) {
687    final Type[] bounds = type == null ? null : type.getBounds();
688    return bounds != null && bounds.length > 0 ? toClass(bounds[0]) : Object.class;
689  }
690
691  private static final Class<?> toClass(final WildcardType type) {
692    final Type[] bounds = type == null ? null : type.getUpperBounds();
693    return bounds != null && bounds.length > 0 ? toClass(bounds[0]) : Object.class;
694  }
695
696
697  /*
698   * Inner and nested classes.
699   */
700
701
702  private static final class TypeNameComparator implements Comparator<Type> {
703
704    @Override
705    public final int compare(final Type t1, final Type t2) {
706      return t1.equals(t2) ? 0 : t1.getTypeName().compareTo(t2.getTypeName());
707    }
708
709  }
710
711}
